NFHL_FLD_ZONE.description: The flood hazard zone classification describes the level and type of flood risk assigned to the location based on FEMA floodplain mapping.

code_map.A: This zone indicates areas prone to 1-percent-annual-chance flooding without detailed hydraulic analysis, impacting bridge design by necessitating conservative assumptions for flood load calculations.
code_map.AE: This zone represents areas with 1-percent-annual-chance flooding where detailed hydraulic studies provide base flood elevations, crucial for precise bridge elevation and foundation design.
code_map.AO: This zone covers areas with shallow flooding characterized by ponding or sheet flow, requiring bridge designs to accommodate potential water accumulation and drainage considerations.
code_map.AH: This zone includes areas with shallow flooding and provided base flood elevations, informing bridge design to ensure structural resilience against ponding-induced loads.
code_map.V: This zone identifies coastal areas with 1-percent-annual-chance flooding and storm-induced wave action, necessitating robust bridge designs to withstand dynamic wave forces.
code_map.VE: This zone specifies coastal areas with 1-percent-annual-chance flooding and wave action, with base flood elevations guiding precise structural and foundation design for wave impact resistance.
code_map.X: This zone denotes areas outside the 1-percent-annual-chance floodplain, indicating minimal flood risk, allowing for standard bridge design without extensive flood mitigation measures.
code_map.X (0.2%): This zone indicates areas with 0.2-percent-annual-chance flooding, representing low-probability flood risk, which may influence long-term bridge resilience planning.
code_map.D: This zone represents areas with undetermined flood hazards due to insufficient data, requiring bridge engineers to adopt conservative design approaches to account for potential unknown risks.

NFHL_FLD_ZONE.title: Flood Hazard Zone

NFHL_SFHA.description: The indicator of Special Flood Hazard Area status describes whether the location is subject to a 1-percent-annual-chance (100-year) flood hazard.

code_map.T: The location is within a Special Flood Hazard Area, indicating a high risk of experiencing a 1-percent-annual-chance flood, necessitating robust flood-resistant design and mitigation strategies for bridge infrastructure.
code_map.F: The location is outside the Special Flood Hazard Area, suggesting a lower risk of 1-percent-annual-chance flooding, allowing for standard design considerations without extensive flood-specific adaptations.

NFHL_SFHA.title: Flood Hazard Status

NFHL_STATIC_BFE.description: The base flood elevation represents the estimated water surface height reached during a 1-percent-annual-chance (100-year) flood event, providing a quantitative measure of flood depth and hydraulic demand at the location.

sentences: Bridges with a base flood elevation under 50 feet are considered to have minimal flood risk, typically requiring standard flood protection measures and routine inspections.
Bridges with a base flood elevation between 50 and 150 feet face moderate flood risk, necessitating enhanced flood mitigation strategies and more frequent structural assessments to ensure resilience.
Bridges with a base flood elevation between 150 and 300 feet are at high flood risk, demanding robust flood defense systems and regular evaluations to maintain structural integrity and safety.

Bridges with a base flood elevation between 300 and 500 feet experience very high flood risk, requiring comprehensive flood management plans and potentially significant design modifications to withstand hydraulic forces.

Bridges with a base flood elevation exceeding 500 feet are subject to extreme flood risk, often needing specialized engineering solutions and continuous monitoring to prevent catastrophic failure during severe flood events.

NFHL_STATIC_BFE.title: Base Flood Elevation

NFHL_ZONE_SUBTYPE.description: The flood zone subtype provides a more specific categorical description of flood hazard conditions within the mapped flood zone, such as minimal, shallow, or coastal risk.
NFHL_ZONE_SUBTYPE.title: Flood Zone Subtype
